title: Can you work in mexico with US H1B
question: Will you be able to continue to keep your US H1 B Status if you do work in mexico.Is there any option work for a mexican company and still retain your H1B Status
answers:
Your H1B status is operative when you are working in the US. You do not lose the quota or the H1B when you are outside the United States. Therefore, if you are working outside US, your H1B does not get revoked unless the company employing you revokes the H1B. If they revoke the H1B, you can still transfer to another company without having to go through the quota unless you have completed the 6 years and you do not have a 365 days pending labor certification or an approved I-140. Note that time spent outside or on H4 do not count towards the six years.(Time spent outside can be recaptured) For more details about your case, please call a good immigration lawyer familiar with employment based immigration.

A person who is an H-1B visa holder who needs to go on an overseas assignment temporarily may retain his/her H-1B status. Time spent outside the US in H-1B status may be recaptured when the H-1B holder seeks an extension of status.
